title: Terrace sees decline in fire department calls

content_html: Terrace city council reviewed a series of bi-annual departmental reports covering the first half of 2025 at its July 28 meeting, providing the public with updates on municipal operations, finances, infrastructure, and community services. The reports, presented twice annually, give residents and council a snapshot of key accomplishments, challenges, and spending across eight city departments. Fire Department From January to June, the Terrace Fire Department responded to 457 incidents, down 16.2 per cent from the previous six months. Calls included 131 medical emergencies—61 involving overdoses or cardiac arrests—179 fire responses, 40 motor vehicle accidents, nine hazardous materials incidents, five wild-land fires, and four dumpster fires.
